Plant Based Diet.name: The Curious Kitchen
Plant Based Diet.description: Test your knowledge of plant-based staples and culinary traditions with this fun and informative quiz. From kosher guidelines to surprising fruit hybrids, discover fascinating facts about the foods we eat.

questions.text: Which of the following is a natural sugar found in most fruits?
questions.hint: This sugar’s name starts with ‘fru,’ linking it to fruit.

questions.text: Which of these foods is not traditionally considered kosher?
questions.hint: This food is forbidden in Jewish dietary laws due to its lack of fins and scales.

questions.text: According to the USDA, which food group should you eat the most servings of per day?
questions.hint: This food group forms the base of the traditional food pyramid, providing energy.

questions.text: What is the name of the fruit that is half tangerine and half grapefruit?
questions.hint: The name is a blend of the two parent fruits, starting with 'tang.'

questions.text: What is the principal ingredient in traditional cole slaw?
questions.hint: This vegetable is shredded to give coleslaw its crunchy texture.

questions.text: What important food crop is grown in fields called paddies?
questions.hint: This crop is a staple for much of Asia and requires flooded fields to grow.

questions.text: Which of these foods is poisonous to dogs?
questions.hint: This sweet treat contains theobromine, which is toxic to canines.

questions.text: A pita is a type of what?
questions.hint: It's a staple in Middle Eastern cuisine, often used to scoop up dips like hummus.
